heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 03 October 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (186°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (232.0°) by approximately 46.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.0°C) and outside temperature (down 2.5°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 3737 lux) and cloud levels (up 277 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 4074 lux), cloud levels (up 462 m), feels like temperature (up 1.8°C), and outside temperature (up 1.6°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 276.8m lower than yesterday, 213.8m lower than the past week, 461.6m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 809m and a peak of 2820m, averaging 1206.4m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: The clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, humidity should not be a concern and very little to no wind will be present. Drizzle or light rain possible, the clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected, and bright intervals likely. The weather will likely remain the same.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
